mapper.sql: id, country, user_id, platform_code, platform_id, platform_terminal, interface_type, website_domain, url_path, create_time

id,
country,
user_id,
platform_id,
platform_terminal,
interface_type,
website_domain,
url_path,
create_time,

mapper.update:
update data_interface_invoke
country = #{country,jdbcType=INTEGER},
user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
platform_id = #{platformId,jdbcType=INTEGER},
platform_terminal = #{platformTerminal,jdbcType=INTEGER},
interface_type = #{interfaceType,jdbcType=INTEGER},
website_domain = #{websiteDomain,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
url_path = #{urlPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR},
create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP},
where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}

update data_interface_invoke set country = #{country,jdbcType=INTEGER}, user_id = #{userId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, platform_id = #{platformId,jdbcType=INTEGER}, platform_terminal = #{platformTerminal,jdbcType=INTEGER}, interface_type = #{interfaceType,jdbcType=INTEGER}, website_domain = #{websiteDomain,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, url_path = #{urlPath,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=BIGINT}
mapper.select:
select interface_type as interfaceType, count(user_id) as invokeCount from data_interface_invoke where country = 0
and create_time>= date_sub(DATE_FORMAT(#{endDate},'%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%S'), interval #{intervalTime} minute)
and create_time<DATE_FORMAT(#{endDate},'%Y-%m-%d %H:%i:%S')
group by interface_type
